text.div:
Vital_Records_Common_Profiles_Library

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vr-common-library/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.vr-common-library

The purpose of this project is to create an HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) Library standard to support the needs of multiple Vital Records Implementation Guides.

This guide is a FHIR Resources (FHIR) Library to support the needs of multiple Vital Records Implementation Guides. It does not provide any use case or scenario specific content or additional guidance on how to use these artifacts, but serves as a source for a standard set of profiles for reuse in multiple use case specific implementation guides focusing on the exchange of Vital Records information. Implementation details such as how and when to use a given artifact will be supplied in these guides.

Background

After evaluation and analysis of two separate FHIR IG projects - Birth Defects Reporting and Birth and Fetal Death Reporting, it was determined that there are many common data elements between the two IGs. The short-term scope of this common profiles library will include data elements common to the above-mentioned FHIR IGs and will define a US Realm specific framework that defines common elements for the implementation guides. The longer-term scope of this profiles library will include analysis and possible inclusion of data elements from other Vital Records projects (such as Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting FHIR IG).

To avoid defining the same profiles multiple times, this IG contains a US Realm focused profile library for use by Vital Records and other FHIR standards development efforts to define the appropriate FHIR profiles, value sets, etc., once and allow them to be referenced by each of the specific implementation guides. This profile library will provide a standard framework for inclusion in multiple use case specific implementation guides focused on the exchange of Vital Records information to support interoperability among public health systems and reduce provider and implementer burden. This FHIR implementation guide uses the US Core profiles. Where this FHIR implementation guide is unable to use a US Core profile, we have followed the Cross Group Projects WG's variance request process, and have provided the US Realm Steering Committee an approved rationale for deviation in the implementation guide.

For Clinical Safety Information please refer to the FHIR Implementer’s Safety Checklist.

How to Read This Guide

This Guide is divided into several pages which are listed at the top of each page in the menu bar.

  • Home: The home page provides the introduction and background for HL7 FHIR® Vital Records Common Profiles Library.
  • Terminology: This page provides a listing of the value sets used in this guide.
  • Downloads: This page provides links to downloadable artifacts.
  • Artifact Index: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts (profiles, examples, and value sets) defined as part of this guide.

name: Vital_Records_Common_Profiles_Library
title: Vital Records Common Profiles Library
publisher: HL7 International - Public Health Work Group
description:
The purpose of this project is to create an HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) Library standard to support the needs of multiple Vital Records Implementation Guides.

This guide is a FHIR Resources (FHIR) Library to support the needs of multiple Vital Records Implementation Guides. It does not provide any use case or scenario specific content or additional guidance on how to use these artifacts, but serves as a source for a standard set of profiles for reuse in multiple use case specific implementation guides focusing on the exchange of Vital Records information. Implementation details such as how and when to use a given artifact will be supplied in these guides.

### Background
After evaluation and analysis of two separate FHIR IG projects - [Birth Defects Reporting](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-birthdefectsreporting-ig/) and [Birth and Fetal Death Reporting](http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-bfdr), it was determined that there are many common data elements between the two IGs. The short-term scope of this common profiles library will include data elements common to the above-mentioned FHIR IGs and will define a US Realm specific framework that defines common elements for the implementation guides. The longer-term scope of this profiles library will include analysis and possible inclusion of data elements from other Vital Records projects (such as [Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting FHIR IG](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/vrdr/)).

To avoid defining the same profiles multiple times, this IG contains a US Realm focused profile library for use by Vital Records and other FHIR standards development efforts to define the appropriate FHIR profiles, value sets, etc., once and allow them to be referenced by each of the specific implementation guides. This profile library will provide a standard framework for inclusion in multiple use case specific implementation guides focused on the exchange of Vital Records information to support interoperability among public health systems and reduce provider and implementer burden. This FHIR implementation guide uses the US Core profiles. Where this FHIR implementation guide is unable to use a US Core profile, we have followed the Cross Group Projects WG's variance request process, and have provided the US Realm Steering Committee an approved rationale for deviation in the implementation guide.

For Clinical Safety Information please refer to the [FHIR Implementer’s Safety Checklist](http://hl7.org/fhir/safety.html).

### How to Read This Guide

This Guide is divided into several pages which are listed at the top of each page in the menu bar.

* Home: The home page provides the introduction and background for HL7 FHIR® Vital Records Common Profiles Library.
* Terminology: This page provides a listing of the value sets used in this guide.
* Downloads: This page provides links to downloadable artifacts.
* Artifact Index: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts (profiles, examples, and value sets) defined as part of this guide.

resource.name: Observation - Pregnancy Risk Factor example [Carmen Teresa Lee: Hypertensive disorder, systemic arterial]
resource.description: Example of Observation-pregnancy-risk-factor profile (Carmen Teresa Lee: Hypertensive disorder, systemic arterial)

resource.name: Patient - Child example [Baby G Quinn]
resource.description: Example of Patient-child profile (Baby G Quinn)

resource.name: Patient - Decedent Fetus example [Fetus Not Named]
resource.description: Example of patient-decedent-fetus (Fetus Not Named)

resource.name: Practitioner - Vital Records example [Janet Seito]
resource.description: Example of Practitioner-vital-records profile (Janet Seito)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Mother Gestaional example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Relatedperson-gestational profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Father Natural example [Tom Yan Lee]
resource.description: Example of relatedperson-father-natural (Tom Yan Lee)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Father example [Tom Yan Lee]
resource.description: Example of relatedperson-father (Tom Yan Lee)

resource.name: Patient - Mother example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of patient-mother profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: APGAR Score Timing
resource.description: Standard timings for APGAR assessments.

resource.name: Education Level Person
resource.description: Persons for whom education level can be reported.

resource.name: Extension - RelatedPerson Deceased
resource.description: The deceased indicator for a RelatedPerson. Deceased date/time is preferred.

resource.name: Extension - RelatedPerson Birth Place
resource.description: The registered place of birth for the related person. A sytem may use the address.text if they don't store the birthPlace address in discrete elements.

resource.name: Extension - Within City Limits Indicator
resource.description: Used to indicate whether or not an address is within city limits. The content of the component shall be a value from the value set Yes No Unknown.

resource.name: Father Relationship
resource.description: Relationships describing the father's role relative to the subject

resource.name: Mother Relationship
resource.description: Relationships describing the mother's role relative to the subject

resource.name: Observation - APGAR Score
resource.description: APGAR score post-birth.

resource.name: Observation - APGAR Score example [BabyG Quinn: 5 min]
resource.description: Example of Observation-apgar-score profile (Babyg Quinn: 5 min)

resource.name: Observation - Autopsy Performed
resource.description: An indication if an autopsy has been performed on the subject.

resource.name: Observation - Autopsy Performed example [Fetus Not Named]
resource.description: Example of Observation-autopsy-performed profile (Fetus Not Named)

resource.name: Observation - Birth Weight
resource.description: The weight of the infant/fetus at birth/delivery.

resource.name: Observation - Birth Weight example [Baby G Quinn]
resource.description: Example of observation-birth-weight profile (Baby G Quinn)

resource.name: Observation - Birth Weight example [Fetus Not Named]
resource.description: Example of Observation-birth-weight (Fetus Not Named)

resource.name: Observation - Gestational Age
resource.description: The obstetric estimate of the infant’s gestation in completed weeks based on the birth/delivery attendant’s final estimate of gestation which should be determined by all perinatal factors and assessments such as ultrasound, but not the neonatal exam.

resource.name: Observation - Gestational Age at Delivery example [Baby G Quinn]
resource.description: Example of  Gestational Age at Delivery profile (Baby G Quinn)

resource.name: Observation - Gestational Age at Delivery example [Fetus Not Named]
resource.description: Example of Observation-gestational-age-at-delivery profile (Fetus Not Named)

resource.name: Observation - Infant Living
resource.description: An indication of whether the infant is living at the time the report is being submitted.

resource.name: Observation - Infant Living example [Baby G Quinn]
resource.description: Example of observation-infant-living profile (Baby G Quinn)

resource.name: Observation - Last Menstrual Period
resource.description: This profile represents the date of the last menstrual period of the patient. The first day of last menstrual period should be captured. The effectiveTime captures the observation date.

resource.name: Observation - Last Menstrual Period example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-last-menstrual-period profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Mother Delivery Weight
resource.description: The weight of the mother at the time of birth/delivery.

resource.name: Observation - Mother Delivery Weight example [Jada Ann Quinn]
resource.description: Example of observation-mother-delivery-weight profile (Jada Ann Quinn)

resource.name: Observation - Mother Height
resource.description: The height of the mother.

resource.name: Observation - Mother Height example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-mother-height profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Mother Pre-Pregnancy Weight
resource.description: The weight of the mother before becoming pregnant.

resource.name: Observation - Mother Prepregnancy Weight example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-mother-prepregnancy-weight profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Number Births Now Dead
resource.description: The total number of previous live-born infants for the mother now dead.

resource.name: Observation - Number Births Now Dead example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-number-births-now-dead (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Number Births Now Living
resource.description: The total number of previous live-born infants for the mother now living.

resource.name: Observation - Number Fetal Deaths This Delivery
resource.description: The number of fetal deaths in this delivery.

resource.name: Observation - Number Live Births This Delivery
resource.description: The number of live births in this delivery.

resource.name: Observation - Number of Births Now Living example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of observation-number-births-now-living profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Number of Fetal Deaths This Delivery example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-number-fetal-deaths-this-delivery profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Number of Prenatal Visits
resource.description: The total number of prenatal visits for the mother. The dates of the first and last prenatal visit are indicated by the effective date range. If the mother received no prenatal care, the value should indicate 0 visits.

resource.name: Observation - Number Other Pregnancy Outcomes
resource.description: The total number of other pregnancy outcomes for the mother that did not result in a live birth  (included pregnancy losses of any gestational age, e.g., spontaneous or induced losses or ectopic pregnancies).

resource.name: Observation - Number Prenatal Visits example [Jada Ann Quinn]
resource.description: Example of Observation-number-prenatal-visits profile (BabyG Quinn/Jada Ann Quinn)

resource.name: Observation - Number Previous Cesareans
resource.description: The total number of prior cesarean deliveries for the mother.

resource.name: Observation - Parent Education Level
resource.description: The highest degree or level of schooling completed by the parent.

resource.name: Observation - Parent Education Level example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of observation-parent-education-level profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Plurality
resource.description: The number of fetuses delivered live or dead at any time in the pregnancy regardless of gestational age, or if the fetuses were delivered at different dates in the pregnancy. ('Reabsorbed' fetuses, those which are not 'delivered' (expulsed or extracted from the mother) should not be counted.) Include all live births and fetal losses resulting from this pregnancy.

resource.name: Observation - Plurality example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-plurality profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Pregnancy Risk Factor
resource.description: Selected medical risk factors of the mother during the pregnancy.

resource.name: Observation - Number Previous Cesareans example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-number-previous-cesareans profile (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Patient - Child
resource.description: The subject patient (newborn/infant/child) for whom clinical data is included in the report.

resource.name: Patient - Decedent Fetus
resource.description: A stillborn for whom clinical data is included in the report.

resource.name: Patient - Mother
resource.description: This Patient profile represents the woman who gave birth to, or delivered the infant.

resource.name: Practitioner - Live Birth and Fetal Death
resource.description: This Practitioner profile represents a practitioner who is involved in vital records (births, fetal death, death, etc.) as a certifier or an attendant. This profile is based on the US Core Practitioner and adds a further constraint to capture the title of the practitioner.

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Parent
resource.description: The RelatedPerson profile contains constraints common to the Mother and Father profiles.

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Father
resource.description: The father of the subject. Different individuals may play different roles as the father (eg. biological father, adoptive father, etc)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Father Natural
resource.description: The biological (natural) father of the newborn or fetus.

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Mother
resource.description: The mother of the report subject. Different individuals may play different roles as the mother (eg. biological mother, adoptive mother, etc)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Mother Gestational
resource.description: The woman who gave birth to, or delivered the infant. The RelatedPerson structure is required in order to link the mother to the newborn or fetus.

resource.name: Date Part
resource.description: This value set contains codes to identify the parts of a date

resource.name: Extension - Date Part Absent Reason
resource.description: Provides a reason why an expected date part is missing.

resource.name: Patient - Mother Jada Ann Quinn
resource.description: Example of Patient-mother profile (Jada Ann Quinn)

resource.name: Observation - Number Live Births This Delivery example [Carmen Teresa Lee]
resource.description: Example of Observation-number-live-births-this-delivery (Carmen Teresa Lee)

resource.name: Observation - Number Other Pregnancy Outcomes example [Jada Ann Quinn]
resource.description: Example of Observation-number-other-pregnancy-outcomes (Jada Ann Quinn)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Stepmother
resource.description: Example of RelatedPerson-parent profile (stepmother)

resource.name: Observation - Race
resource.description: This profile represents a single race code assigned to the person. If the value is unknown, set dataAbsentReason to "unknown".

resource.name: Observation - Tabulated Ethnicity
resource.description: This profile records a code representing the ethnic affiliation information for the mother or father. The observation will convey, as coded data, information that is provided in text form.  If the value is unknown, set dataAbsentReason to "unknown".

resource.name: Observation - Race example [Jada Ann Quinn]
resource.description: Observation - Race example [Jada Ann Quinn]

resource.name: Observation - Tabulated Ethnicity example [Jada Ann Quinn]
resource.description: Observation - Tabulated Ethnicity example [Jada Ann Quinn]

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Adoptive Mother
resource.description: Example of RelatedPerson-mother profile (adoptive mother)

resource.name: Patient - Mother Date Part Absent
resource.description: Example of Patient-mother profile (Date Part Absent)

resource.name: RelatedPerson - Adoptive Father
resource.description: Example of RelatedPerson-father profile (adoptive father)
